metadata.title: CVE-2014-1528 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The sse2_composite_src_x888_8888 function in Pixman, as used in Cairo inMozilla Firefox 28.0 and SeaMonkey 2.25 on Windows, allows remote attackersto execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds writeand application crash) by painting on a CANVAS element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
